alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Inland Bay; Jackson; Liberty; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Jackson, northeastern Bay and northern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Gadsden, northwestern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida and eastern Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/... At 716 PM EDT/616 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Chattahoochee to 7 miles southwest of Marianna to Chipley. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chipley, Blountstown, Chattahoochee, Bradford, Sneads, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Altha, Alford, Rock Bluff, Moose Pond, Clarksville, Ocheesee, Selman, Chipola, Camps Head, Kennys Mill, Porter Lake, Lowry and Chipley Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Gadsden; Inland Bay; Jackson; Liberty; Washington
